comment.author: 23588713@N05
comment._content: This is the "Dolmen de Crucuno" in Plouharnel. www.plouharnel.fr/patrimoine-megalithique/dolmen-de-crucu...

comment.author: 34419668@N08
comment._content: Dominoa: Thanks for the interesting suggestion, but are you quite sure..? I think the upright stones of the Crucuno dolmen look quite different (kind of more "close"..) - but the building behind could be the same... Here are some more photos on Google to compare with. /Anna B.

comment.author: 90215087@N02
comment._content: This must be an awesome site to behold in reality that can take one back to prehistoric times before even caves were found. The Dolmen concept is the origin of how architecture evolved by having a roof supported by vertical members.
